Detailed Description

Terrestrial objects are ones that walk around on the ground and can jump.

Todo:
The logic dealing with crawling (and, in particular, forcing crawls when there's no headroom) is rather convoluted and should be improved.

Member Function Documentation

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.adjustCollision (   self,
  collision 
)

Adjust collision detection inputs so that we can properly track the terrain.

Note: we use self.wasGrounded instead of self.isGrounded here because self.isGrounded is invalidated before collision detection starts.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.blockIsAtFootLevel (   self,
  block 
)

Return true if the given block is near our foot level.

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.canGrabLedge (   self  ) 

Return true if we are in position to grab the top of a block.

We can only grab blocks that do not have other blocks above them. There are two possible blocks we can grab: the top of a square block, or the bottom of a triangular one.

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.completeAnimation (   self,
  animation 
)

Wrap up after finishing a climb.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

Reimplemented in player.Player.

Determine direction of acceleration.

  targetHeight,
  shouldUseBack = False 
)

Return the point on the polygon that matches the target height and is on the given side.

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.getFootLoc (   self,
  shouldUseBack = False 
)

Return the "foot" of this object, which is the bottom vertex of the bounding polygon that is furthest in our direction of travel.

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.getHeadLoc (   self,
  shouldUseBack = False 
)

As getFootLoc, but applies to the top of the object instead of the bottom.

  collision

Hitting the ceiling when jumping forces us to start freefall.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

Hitting the floor makes us grounded.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.hitTerrain (   self,
  collision 
)

Basic logic for hitting any terrain at all.

The only thing we care about is that if we hit a block with a non-upwards ejection vector and we're trialling standing, or if we hit a block with a horizontal ejection vector and we're trialling crawling, then we need to give up on the trial.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.hitWall (   self,
  collision 
)

Hitting the wall makes us stop moving, and may let us hang.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.postCollisionUpdate (   self  ) 

Handle updating the creature's state after collision detection is done.

Enter freefall if we didn't hit a floor; set sprite animations.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

def terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.preCollisionUpdate (   self  ) 

Apply acceleration if the creature is moving; start jumps and negate gravity as needed if the creature is in the air.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

Member Data Documentation

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.airAcceleration

Rate at which air control (moving while in air) adds to velocity.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.airDeceleration

Rate at which air control deceleration detracts from velocity.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.canHang

Signals if the creature has the ability to hang from ledges.

Reimplemented in data.objects.creatures.darkclone.DarkClone, and player.Player.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.gravity

Acceleration due to gravity, added to self.vel each update cycle.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.haveChangedAction

Indicates that we've already tried changing the player's current action this frame.

This is used when "trying out" different actions to see if there's room e.g. to stand up from a crawl.

Todo:
Seems like there should be a better way to handle this.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.isCrawling

Indicates that the creature is currently crawling.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.isGravityOn

True if gravity should be applied during the update cycle.

Reimplemented from physicsobject.PhysicsObject.

Reimplemented in player.Player.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.isGrounded

When grounded, we apply running acceleration, can jump, and can crouch if the creature has that ability.

Reimplemented in player.Player.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.isHanging

Used when the creature is hanging from a ledge.

Negates gravity and limits available controls.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.jumpFrames

Number of frames that the jump action has been "held".

Commence freefall logger.debug("Ran out of ground; commencing freefall").

Holding the jump action negates gravity so that jump height can be controlled.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.jumpSpeed

Vertical speed at the start of a jump.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.justJumped

Used to signal that the creature has started a jump.

Set this in your AI routines to jump.

Reimplemented in player.Player.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.justStartedClimbing

Used to signal that the creature has started climbing from a hanging position.

Reimplemented in data.objects.creatures.darkclone.DarkClone, and player.Player.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.justStoppedHanging

Used to signal that the creature has stopped hanging.

Reimplemented in player.Player.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.maxJumpRiseFrames

Maximum number of frames that gravity can be negated by holding the jump action.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.runAcceleration

Rate at which running (moving while grounded) adds to velocity.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.runDeceleration

Rate at which slowing to a stop on the ground detracts from velocity.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.runDirection

Direction creature is trying to move in.

Set this to -1 to move left, 0 to not move, or 1 to move right.

Reimplemented in data.objects.creatures.darkclone.DarkClone, and player.Player.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.shouldCrawl

Used to signal that the creature should try to crawl.

Reimplemented in player.Player.

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.wasCrawling

Indicates if the creature was crawling on the previous frame.

Used to detect when there's no room to crawl (or no room to stand).

terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.wasGrounded

Used when checking for the floor during collision detection.

True if, before collision detection, the creature was grounded.
